Hydrogen-fuel is appealing for use in cars like the Vauxhall Zafira minivan. But producing hydrogen requires huge amounts of energy. But with the new breakthrough, it could be possible to make it more easily. The process splits water into hydrogen and oxygen. But the latter part is more difficult and lots of energy is lost. New catalyst, placed on an electrode used in the process, is much more efficient. This means it could be used to store energy from renewable sources.

Facebook has launched a new app called Hello designed to give you more control over who can call you. It pulls in any publicly-shared data from a user's Facebook profile. When a user receives a call, Hello shows them info about who’s calling, even if they don’t have that number saved. It is currently in testing and is only available on Android devices in the US.
Russian scientist says the distant ancestor of humans had tentacles. They lived in the seas 635 to 541 million years ago and used them for food. It's likely they also had a complex nervous system like we do today. This puts to bed another theory that our ancestors were worms.

The initiative, dubbed Nexus for Exoplanet System Science (Nexss), will include scientists from 10 universities including Stanford, the University of California and Yale. It says amateur astronomers could help with its 'unprecedented' search for ET by accessing research data online.

Archaeologists have discovered evidence Neanderthals regularly inhabited the Cave of Llenes, near Senterada in Catalonia, around 200,000 years ago. The remains of cave bears, hyenas, leopards, wolves and badgers have also been found in the cave. Scratches on the walls and hibernation nests indicate cave bears were living in the cave alongside the Neanderthals.

Scientists in The Netherlands were using the Lofar radio telescope. They found it could measure changes in lightning caused by cosmic rays. A storm can have hundreds of millions of volts over multiple kilometres. The method could provide a novel way to understand thunderclouds. It could help scientists understand how lightning affects the radio emissions.

Identical twins share 100 per cent of their genes, meaning it has been impossible to tell which sibling a sample comes from. But until now it has been impossible to tell which sibling a sample comes from. Researchers at the University of Huddersfield have created a technique which they claim can distinguish between the genetic fingerprints of identical twins. The breakthrough may eradicate a stumbling block which has often meant it was impossible to tell which of the pair was guilty of a crime.

41 million tonnes of 'e-waste' worth over £34billion discarded globally in 2014. Only 6 million tonnes of that was recycled properly, according to UNU. Thousands of broken appliances are illegally exported to Africa. They are dumped in landfills like Agbogbloshie in Ghana because it costs less than recycling them in their countries of origin. The UK contributed 1.5 million tonnes of 'e-waste' to Africa in 2014.

The parole board cited his accomplishments, along with his age and good behavior as reasons to grant him parole in March last year. The parole board rejected that decision in August, saying factors in his favor were outweighed by the brutality of the killings and Davis' lack of insight into the crimes.

Between 2004 and 2013, the number of passenger vehicle teen drivers involved in U.S. fatal crashes decreased from 5,724 to 2,568, per 100,000 people. Graduated license restrictions and new safety features in cars are among the top reasons for the dramatic drop in fatalities. Graduated licenses decrease overall crash rate in teen drivers by 20 to 40 per cent.

Yellowstone supervolcano releases 45,000 metric tonnes of carbon dioxide each day. A chamber lying directly beneath its surface is not considered large enough to produce these levels. Researchers have been searching for an alternative source for years. They tracked seismic waves from almost 5,000 earthquakes to find the chamber. It is so large its partly-molten rock could fill the Grand Canyon 11 times over.

Brain scans on professional comedians reveal differences in the way their brains work while talking. Compared to the less silver tongued, the super speakers showed less activity in a key area of the brain involved articulating and comprehending speech. This suggests this group were putting less effort into the basic mechanics of speech, allowing them to devote more resources to what they were going to say next.

Woolly mammoths were the biggest of the Ice Age giants roaming the frozen plains of the Northern Hemisphere. But they were isolated on an Arctic island for around 5,000 years, forcing them to inbreed as their population dwindled. Scientists have now inserted more than a dozen of the creature’s genes into the live DNA of an elephant.

Scientists in Colorado have found evidence for a new solar season cycle. Every two years it appears 'bands' of magnetic field move to the surface. This combines with the existing 11-year solar cycle, causing even more powerful coronal mass ejections (CMEs) and solar flares. The changes are driven by twisted, ring-shaped 'bands' of magnetic field. These 'bands' of magnetic field rise from the solar interior and pass to the surface through the tachocline.

The fossil is being sold by Hong Kong-based experts at Evolved. It is more than 95 per cent complete bone, is 9.2ft (2.8 metres) long, 5.2ft (1.6 metres) high and 4.6ft (1.4 metres) wide. It belonged to a male Triceratops that lived 66 million years ago. The last time something of this size and quality came to market was when a Tyrannosaurus Rex fossil named 'Sue' was sold for £5.6 million ($8.5 million) in 1997.

Scientists in Pisa, Italy, used CT scans of teeth found in northern Italy. They found the teeth belonged to a group known as the Protoaurignacian culture. They suggest the arrival of this modern human culture played a role in the demise of Neanderthals. Neanderthals were the dominant human species in Europe and much of Asia for around 250,000 years before vanishing 41,000 years ago.

Jonathon Keats, an experimental philosopher and conceptual artist, has designed a'millennium camera' that he intends to mount in a churchless steeple on a college campus. The camera is made of cooper and allows light to enter through a tiny hole and change paint inside. Keats hopes the resulting photograph will chronicle climate change by taking a 1,000-year exposure of a western Massachusetts mountain range.

Scientists from the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Zurich say that 75% of extreme hot weather and 18% of heavy precipitation is being driven by global warming. They say as climate change pushes global temperatures higher, humans will become responsible for 40% of extreme rainfall events. Global temperatures were the highest since records began in 1880.

President Obama relaxed drone restrictions in Pakistan in 2013 to reduce civilian casualties. The CIA was granted a waiver on providing proof that intended targets of drone strikes posed an imminent threat to the US. The last Inca rope bridge, the Keshwa Chaca, spans the Apurimac River near Huinchiri, Peru. It is estimated that the Inca kingdom was connected by some 200 bridges, all made by hand. The last Incas disappeared in the early 17th century, and over the years their bridges followed.

Extra stretch of coastline on east coast of Hokkaido Island has risen as high as 50ft from sea surface in some places. Geologists believe emergence is a result of a landslide nearby, when melting ice and snow caused a section of land to drop. The St Ivan Rilski Church is the only remaining evidence of the community of Zapalnya, Bulgaria, where residents were forced to leave. Named after patron saint of Bulgaria, the crumbling stone structure now cuts a ghostly figure in a few feet of water. The EOssc2 is described as an 'ultra flexible micro-car for mega cities' It is designed to connect to others to form a train and can be driven in two directions. It pivots using wheels powered by separate motors and shrinks from 8ft (2.5metres) to 5ft ft (1.5metres) The car is intended to be semi-autonomous and can be driven in the traditional way, diagonally and sideways.
Chilesaurus diegosuarezi is a new lineage of dinosaur that grazed on plants. It is closely related to Tyrannosaurus rex, but was a vegetarian. Palaeontologists are referring to it as a 'platypus' because of its bizarre combination of characteristics, including its small skull and feet. Theropod group of dinosaurs includes the famous meat eaters Velociraptor, Carnotaurus and Tyrannosaurus.

Buy and Keep launched in April 2014 for Sky+HD subscribers. It lets people stream movies straight to their TV, or to their mobiles. Films can also be watched across multiple devices using a 'follow me' function. New releases cost £13.99 and classics are £7.99. By comparison, the latest releases on Talk Talk-owned Blinkbox start at £3.49 to rent or £8.99 to buy a digital copy.

Nasa scientists in California have revealed an interactive 3D map for Vesta. The map lets you see features on the surface including craters, hills, mountains and even 'canyons' The map also lets you fly around like you were in your own spacecraft. You can also measure elevation changes on the surface and see different angles of the sun. The map also lets you see the craters on the asteroid's surface.

Spitfire P9374 was among the first built in March 1940 but never made it to the Battle of Britain as it crashed-landed in May 1940. It was being piloted by Flying Officer Peter Cazenove over Dunkirk when it was hit by a single bullet from a German Dornier bomber. Cazenove was captured by the Nazis and taken to the German prisoner of war camp Stalag Luft III. In 1980 the wreckage was discovered when part of it was spotted poking out from its sandy grave.

There are thought to be less than 1 million hedgehogs living in this country today. An estimated 30 per cent drop since 2013 has led to the decline. Part of the reason is the widespread loss of traditional hedgerows. But the loss of bushes and hedges in back gardens is also thought to have played a role in the animal’s demise.

Some 1,000 carved Moai statues line the perimeter of the 12 mile (25km) volcanic island, which is the most isolated inhabited landmass on Earth with just 6,000 residents. Experts believe the 'hats' were rolled up ramps to reach the top of the figures which measure up to 40ft (12 metres) tall. The largest pukaos measure six-and-a-half feet (two metres) in diameter and weighing 12 tonnes (1,890 stone)

Researchers from National Chung Hsing University in Taiwan studied the expression of a class of genes known to be associated with petal development. They found that in mature orchids, two protein complexes, called the 'L' complex and the 'SP' complex, compete to promote the formation of the lip and standard petals. They found that by reducing the activity of the L complex using gene silencing, they converted lips into petals in two orchid species.
WWF identified 11 'deforestation fronts' where 80 per cent of projected global forest losses by 2030 could occur. The areas are the Amazon, the Atlantic Forest and Gran Chaco, and the Cerrado in South America, the Choco-Darien in Central America, the Congo Basin, East Africa, eastern Australia, the Greater Mekong in South East Asia, Borneo, New Guinea and Sumatra. The fronts are also home to indigenous communities that depend them for their livelihoods.

The condemned pair will be given white clothing to wear and the option to be blindfolded before facing the firing squad. The pair will be led through the jungle up a 3km steep track to the place known as Nirbaya. The pair will be led through the wildly dense tropical forest up a 3km steep winding track to the place known as Death Valley.
Greg Hardy was forced to abandon his Bentley in flash floods in Dallas. The 25-year-old was forced to leave the car stranded until the waters receded. Hardy was suspended by the NFL just days ago after an incident of domestic abuse that allegedly occurred last year. Hardy was dropped by his previous team, the Carolina Panthers, but was still able to collect his salary during that time.
Apple sold more than 61 million iPhones in the quarter, up 40% from a year ago. Revenue from Mac computers rose 2 percent from a year earlier, to $5.6 billion. iPad revenue fell 29 percent, to $5.4 billion, continuing a steady decline in tablet sales.
Angus Hawley, 46, died of a suspected heart attack in New York on Saturday. His brother David said he doesn't understand the death of his fit and healthy brother. Angus was in New York attending a business conference at the time. He was a father to four children, Lucia, 16, Hamish, 14, James, 12, and Sybella, eight.
